definition: down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action
country or countryside/native place/home village or town/township (PRC administrative unit)
to work in the fields (esp. young school-leavers)/forced agricultural experience for city intellectuals

sentences.english: We walked a long way to see him, only to find that he had just left for the countryside.
sentences.chinese: 我们走了很长一段路去看他，没想到他刚好下乡了。

sentences.english: Another 2 billion was used to extend to 12 provincial-level administrative areas the program to grant subsidies to enable rural residents to buy home appliances.
sentences.chinese: 家电下乡试点扩大到12个省份，补贴20亿元。

sentences.english: This paper is a critical interpretation of the book Deliver Knowledge of Law to the Rural Areas by Su Li.
sentences.chinese: 本文是对苏力的《送法下乡》一书的批评性解读。

sentences.english: We will continue to implement the policies of providing subsidies for rural residents to purchase home appliances and subsidies for trading-in old home appliances for new ones.
sentences.chinese: 继续实施家电下乡和以旧换新政策。

sentences.english: Appliances to the countryside, the rural market demand for driving is significant.
sentences.chinese: 家电下乡，对于拉动农村市场需求具有重要的意义。

sentences.english: He was trying to picture what it would be like if they did move to the country.
sentences.chinese: 他努力想象搬下乡去以后生活将是个什么样子。

sentences.english: Some colleagues of mine and I went to countryside for visiting an impoverished student on that day .
sentences.chinese: 那天，我和几位同事下乡慰问一位贫困学生。

sentences.english: Soon, under the age of ten, he will work together with his father poet Gu countryside labor.
sentences.chinese: 不久，未满十岁的他便和父亲诗人顾工一起下乡劳作。

definition: to work in the fields (esp. young school-leavers)/forced agricultural experience for city intellectuals
to visit the poor and ask about their suffering (idiom)
educated youth (sent to work in farms during the Cultural Revolution)

(category defined by the Communist Party) poor and lower-middle peasants: farmers who, before land reform, possessed little or no land (poor peasants) and those who were barely able to support themselves with their own land (lower-middle peasants)
to go to town/to enter a big city (to live or work)
the Four Cleanups Movement (1963-66), which aimed to cleanse the politics, economy, organization and ideology of the Communist Party
